members.docComment:
/**
 * The base-datamodel defines attributes which every document in the database has in common
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Every instance of the base-datamodel (db -\> application layer) should contain standard methods
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: BaseDatamodel

members.docComment:
/**
 * Execute steps before the document will be inserted. Will be executed by {@link BaseDAO} and should not be executed by it's own. Similar to mongoose pre-save-hook
 *
 * @returns 
 *
 * @virtual
 */
members.name: beforeInsert

members.docComment:
/**
 * Execute steps before the document has been updated. Will be executed by {@link BaseDAO} and should not be executed by it's own. The 'updateAt' attribute of the document will be changed by default. Similar to mongoose pre-update-hook
 *
 * @returns 
 *
 * @virtual
 */
members.name: beforeUpdate

members.docComment:
/**
 * Execute steps after the document has been created. Will be executed by {@link BaseDAO}. and should not be executed by it's own. Similar to mongoose post-save-hook
 *
 * @returns 
 *
 * @virtual
 */
members.name: executeAfterCreateDependencies

members.docComment:
/**
 * Execute steps after the document has been deleted. Will be executed by {@link BaseDAO}. and should not be executed by it's own. Similar to mongoose post-delete-hook
 *
 * @returns 
 *
 * @virtual
 */
members.name: executeAfterDeleteDependencies

members.docComment:
/**
 * DTO which exposes only a subset of attributes!
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This class is based on Java DTO. It is meant for consumption by the frontend. Exposes only subset of attributes of a datamodel (f.e not including user password). see https://www.baeldung.com/java-dto-pattern
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: BaseFrontendDTO

members.docComment:
/**
 * A controller which offers CRUD opeartions as REST-Interface on a certain resource. Expects as types `DAO` which has to be of type {@link BaseDAO}, `Datamodel` of type {@link BaseDatamodel} and `FDTO` of type {@link BaseFrontendDTO}
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This class is to be extended by your custom resources.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: BaseModelController

members.docComment:
/**
 * Activates the standard CRUD operations on a resource. The following convention is assumed:
 *
 * GET / - find all resources
 *
 * POST / - create a resource
 *
 * GET /:id - find a specific resource by id
 *
 * PATCH /:id - update a specific resource by id
 *
 * PUT /:id - update a specific resource by id
 *
 * DELETE /:id - delete a specific resource by id
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: activateStandardRouting

 * Whether to only show the root-groups of the user or not.
